page.title: 08Religion: St. Erth Church
page.content: The Saint The Parish, Church and village of St. Erth receive their name from an Irishman who lived from 424 to 5l4 A.D He was Ercus. or Erc, son of Deagh, who had been baptised by the aged St.Patrick and then consecrated Bishop of Slane, in Ireland. He was the brother of St. Ia and St. Uny, who came with him across the Channel to found their respective churches, Ia to St.Ives, Uny to Lelant and Ercus to St.Erth. At that time ships sailed inland as far as where the medieval bridge now spans the Hayle River, and it was about here that Ercus must have landed. Tradition has it that a Church was built and that Ercus consecrated it. Certain it is that the place has been called "St.Erth" (variously spelt) ever since.
